Comment: Well, maybe not from anything incriminating.  However there is one thing that he has that he's very much not immune to that the Russians are almost certainly exploiting, albeit it being far more mundane: money, or more accurately debt.    It's long since been known that no Western bank or institution is willing to do business with Trump, so the only ones that will are Russian ones.  In fact it was even confirmed by one of his sons that Russian banks are the only ones they do business with.    However it's also known that the main reason why Western banks stopped is because Trump is notorious to failing to pay his bills and debts back.  And given how it reached the point he only does business with Russian banks, it's pretty easy to assume that he never broke that habit and still fails to pay his debt with the Russian banks.    Put 2 and 2 together, and it becomes quite apparent what Russia would use to bend him to their will.  "Do this for us, and we'll look the other way on what you owe us.  Maybe even throw in something like a tower in Moscow if you're good enough.  Fail, and your businesses become ours".
Author: Randomman96

Comment: I reckon Trump sees the world as the domain of "great men", everyone subservient to their superior until three or four truly great rulers stand astride the world like colossi.  The reason he loves dealing with Xhi and Putin is that when they deal with him, it implies he's on their level, that they see him as a peer.  But I don't think leaders like Putin or Xhi do see it as a noble fraternity of greatness; I think they see Trump as an easily manipulated buffoon.  I honestly think he wants to help Putin because he sees him as a peer, he wants to promote the way things are done by the Russian government because it's how he'd like to do "business"; and I think he likes Putin and he wants to be his friend.  It doesn't really matter when it comes down to it.  It's pretty clear that the snivelling sack of shit is betraying the interests of the United States on a daily basis.    When the reason a Russian asset shouldn't be POTUS is because they might betray the US for Russian interests, and you suspect him of being a Russian asset because you can see him betraying the US for Russian interests...  there's really some stuff you can skip, there.
